metadata.title: Tuesday, 6th October, 2015
metadata.session: FIFTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)    whether the Government is aware that Shoprite Checkers is importing milk from Poland and, if so, why; and
(b)    what measures the Government has taken to protect the dairy industry.

questions.minister: Minister of Health what measures have been taken to facilitate the transfer of patients from Lungo Mukuta Health Centre to Mansa General Hospital, especially in emergency cases.

Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education when the Government will rehabilitate the classroom block, whose roof was blown off, at Lukweta Primary School in Mkaika Parliamentary Constituency.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of a university in Gwembe District, as promised by the late President of the Republic of Zambia, Mr Michael Chilufya Sata, will commence;
(b)    what the cost of the project is; and
(c)    who the contractor of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing when a market and a bus station will be constructed at Lwela in Chembe Parliamentary Constituency.

parts: (a)    why the Government has allowed other countries, apart from Zimbabwe to use the Victoria Falls in the promotion of tourism in their countries;
(b)    whether the Government derives any benefits from such promotions; and

(c)    if not, what measures have been taken to ensure that Zambia benefits from such promotions. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Thanks - His Excellency the President’s Address - Motion (22nd September) -  Resumption of Debate – (The Deputy Minister – Mr Bwalya).
